verses.text: The burden against Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
parts: burden against Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.

verses.text: God is jealous, and the  avenges;The  avenges and is furious.The  will take vengeance on His adversaries,And He reserves wrath for His enemies;
parts: will take vengeance on His adversaries,

verses.text: The  is slow to anger and great in power,And will not at all acquit the wicked.The  has His wayIn the whirlwind and in the storm,And the clouds are the dust of His feet.
parts: slow to anger and great in power,
And will not at all acquit
In the whirlwind and in the storm,

verses.text: He rebukes the sea and makes it dry,And dries up all the rivers.Bashan and Carmel wither,And the flower of Lebanon wilts.
parts: He rebukes the sea and makes it dry,
And dries up all the rivers.
And the flower of Lebanon wilts.

verses.text: The mountains quake before Him,The hills melt,And the earth heaves at His presence,Yes, the world and all who dwell in it.
parts: Yes, the world and all who dwell in it.

verses.text: Who can stand before His indignation?And who can endure the fierceness of His anger?His fury is poured out like fire,And the rocks are thrown down by Him.
parts: Who can stand before His indignation?
And who can endure the fierceness of His anger?
His fury is poured out like fire,
And the rocks are thrown down by Him.

verses.text: The  is good,A stronghold in the day of trouble;And He knows those who trust in Him.
parts: A stronghold in the day of trouble;
And He knows those who trust in Him.

verses.text: But with an overflowing floodHe will make an utter end of its place,And darkness will pursue His enemies.
parts: He will make an utter end of its place,
And darkness will pursue His enemies.

verses.text: What do you conspire against the ?He will make an utter end of it.Affliction will not rise up a second time.
parts: He will make an utter end
Affliction will not rise up a second time.

verses.text: For while tangled like thorns,And while drunken like drunkards,They shall be devoured like stubble fully dried.
parts: They shall be devoured like stubble fully dried.

verses.text: From you comes forth oneWho plots evil against the ,A wicked counselor.
Thus says the :“Though they are safe, and likewise many,Yet in this manner they will be cut downWhen he passes through.Though I have afflicted you,I will afflict you no more;
parts: Yet in this manner they will be cut down
I will afflict you no more;

verses.text: For now I will break off his yoke from you,And burst your bonds apart.”
parts: For now I will break off his yoke from you,

verses.text: The  has given a command concerning you:“Your name shall be perpetuated no longer.Out of the house of your godsI will cut off the carved image and the molded image.I will dig your grave,For you are vile.”

verses.text: He who scatters has come up before your face.Man the fort!Watch the road!Strengthen your flanks!Fortify your power mightily.
parts: who scatters has come up before your face.

verses.text: For the  will restore the excellence of JacobLike the excellence of Israel,For the emptiers have emptied them outAnd ruined their vine branches.
parts: will restore the excellence of Jacob
For the emptiers have emptied them out

verses.text: The shields of his mighty men are made red,The valiant men are in scarlet.The chariots come with flaming torchesIn the day of his preparation,And the spears are brandished.
parts: The shields of his mighty men
In the day of his preparation,

verses.text: The chariots rage in the streets,They jostle one another in the broad roads;They seem like torches,They run like lightning.
parts: The chariots rage in the streets,
They jostle one another in the broad roads;

verses.text: He remembers his nobles;They stumble in their walk;They make haste to her walls,And the defense is prepared.
parts: They make haste to her walls,

verses.text: The gates of the rivers are opened,And the palace is dissolved.
parts: The gates of the rivers are opened,

verses.text: It is decreed:She shall be led away captive,She shall be brought up;And her maidservants shall lead her as with the voice of doves,Beating their breasts.
parts: She shall be led away captive,
as with the voice of doves,

verses.text: Though Nineveh of old was like a pool of water,Now they flee away.“Halt! Halt!” they cry;But no one turns back.
Take spoil of silver!Take spoil of gold!There is no end of treasure,Or wealth of every desirable prize.
parts: Or wealth of every desirable prize.

verses.text: She is empty, desolate, and waste!The heart melts, and the knees shake;Much pain is in every side,And all their faces are drained of color.
parts: She is empty, desolate, and waste!
The heart melts, and the knees shake;

verses.text: Where is the dwelling of the lions,And the feeding place of the young lions,Where the lion walked, the lioness and lion’s cub,And no one made them afraid?
parts: And the feeding place of the young lions,
Where the lion walked, the lioness

verses.text: The lion tore in pieces enough for his cubs,Killed for his lionesses,Filled his caves with prey,And his dens with flesh.
parts: The lion tore in pieces enough for his cubs,

verses.text: “Behold, I am against you,” says the  of hosts, “I will burn your chariots in smoke, and the sword shall devour your young lions; I will cut off your prey from the earth, and the voice of your messengers shall be heard no more.”

verses.text: Woe to the bloody city!It is all full of lies and robbery.Its victim never departs.
The noise of a whipAnd the noise of rattling wheels,Of galloping horses,Of clattering chariots!
parts: And the noise of rattling wheels,

verses.text: Horsemen charge with bright sword and glittering spear.There is a multitude of slain,A great number of bodies,Countless corpses—They stumble over the corpses—
parts: Horsemen charge with bright sword and glittering spear.

verses.text: Because of the multitude of harlotries of the seductive harlot,The mistress of sorceries,Who sells nations through her harlotries,And families through her sorceries.
parts: Who sells nations through her harlotries,

verses.text: “Behold, I am against you,” says the  of hosts;“I will lift your skirts over your face,I will show the nations your nakedness,And the kingdoms your shame.
parts: “I will lift your skirts over your face,
I will show the nations your nakedness,

verses.text: I will cast abominable filth upon you,Make you vile,And make you a spectacle.
parts: I will cast abominable filth upon you,

verses.text: It shall come to pass that all who look upon youWill flee from you, and say,‘Nineveh is laid waste!Who will bemoan her?’Where shall I seek comforters for you?”
parts: Will flee from you, and say,
Where shall I seek comforters for you?”

verses.text: Are you better than No AmonThat was situated by the River,That had the waters around her,Whose rampart was the sea,Whose wall was the sea?
parts: That had the waters around her,

verses.text: Ethiopia and Egypt were her strength,And it was boundless;Put and Lubim were your helpers.

Yet she was carried away,She went into captivity;Her young children also were dashed to piecesAt the head of every street;They cast lots for her honorable men,And all her great men were bound in chains.
parts: Her young children also were dashed to pieces
At the head of every street;
They cast lots for her honorable men,
And all her great men were bound in chains.

verses.text: You also will be drunk;You will be hidden;You also will seek refuge from the enemy.
parts: You also will seek refuge from the enemy.

verses.text: All your strongholds are fig trees with ripened figs:If they are shaken,They fall into the mouth of the eater.
parts: They fall into the mouth of the eater.

verses.text: Surely, your people in your midst are women!The gates of your land are wide open for your enemies;Fire shall devour the bars of your gates.
parts: Surely, your people in your midst
The gates of your land are wide open for your enemies;

verses.text: Draw your water for the siege!Fortify your strongholds!Go into the clay and tread the mortar!Make strong the brick kiln!
parts: Draw your water for the siege!
Go into the clay and tread the mortar!

verses.text: There the fire will devour you,The sword will cut you off;It will eat you up like a locust.Make yourself many—like the locust!Make yourself many—like the swarming locusts!
parts: There the fire will devour you,
The sword will cut you off;
It will eat you up like a locust.Make yourself many—like the locust!

verses.text: You have multiplied your merchants more than the stars of heaven.The locust plunders and flies away.
parts: You have multiplied your merchants more than the stars of heaven.
The locust plunders and flies away.

verses.text: Your commanders are like swarming locusts,And your generals like great grasshoppers,Which camp in the hedges on a cold day;When the sun rises they flee away,And the place where they are is not known.
parts: And your generals like great grasshoppers,
Which camp in the hedges on a cold day;
When the sun rises they flee away,

verses.text: Your shepherds slumber, O king of Assyria;Your nobles rest in the dust.Your people are scattered on the mountains,And no one gathers them.
parts: Your shepherds slumber, O king of Assyria;
Your people are scattered on the mountains,

verses.text: Your injury has no healing,Your wound is severe.All who hear news of youWill clap their hands over you,For upon whom has not your wickedness passed continually?
parts: All who hear news of you
For upon whom has not your wickedness passed continually?

content_parts.text: His name means “consolation.” He was from the tribe of Simeon and a contemporary of the prophets Zephaniah, Jeremiah, and Habakkuk.
—Between 663 BC (the fall of Thebes) and 612 BC (the fall of Nineveh)
God's judgment and the destruction of Nineveh
God's judgment and the destruction of Nineveh
(capital of the Assyrian Empire) for its idolatry, oppression, cruelty, and wickedness.
God is the Lord of history and of all nations, and their destinies are in His hands.
Christ is revealed as the One who brings good tidings and proclaims peace (1:15).
—The Assyrians had invaded Israel and Judah several times in the eighth and seventh centuries BC.
They were ruthless and cruel to the conquered peoples, deporting them to other lands and bringing in foreigners to mingle with the few Jews who were left.
The prophet Jonah was sent by God to preach to the inhabitants of Nineveh during this time, and they repented.
However, within a few generations the evil and wickedness of their forefathers returned, and the city was at its zenith of power and wickedness when the prophet Nahum prophesied its destruction.
